title: How to Play Bad Piggies

steps.headline: Launch Bad Piggies and tap on the “Play” button.
Tap on “Ground Hog Day,” then select level one.
steps.description: When you first start playing Bad Piggies, you’ll only have access to the first set of levels, categorized as “Ground Hog Day.”

steps.headline: Familiarize yourself with the game’s layout.
steps.description: After the game launches, you’ll be shown a screen with six empty boxes placed in a grid pattern, along with various supplies at the bottom of the screen. Your goal is to drag and drop each of the supplies into the grid to create a vehicle that can be used to transport your piggy to the finish line. For example, level one provides you with two wheels and three boxes.

steps.headline: Click and drag each supply over to its position in the grid to create a vehicle.
steps.description: For example, in level one you must move both wheels to the bottom of the grid, then place all three boxes on top of the wheels to create a boxcar, or wagon.

steps.headline: Click and drag the piggy over to your vehicle.
steps.description: This places the piggy in the vehicle so it can be driven to the finish line.

steps.headline: Click on the checkmark icon.
steps.description: Your vehicle will start driving by itself toward the finish line. Once you’ve crossed the finish line, you can advance to the next level.

steps.headline: Use the buttons displayed at the bottom of the screen to help you reach your goal after your vehicle starts driving on its own.
steps.description: These buttons feature extra tools such as balloons, bottle rockets, motors, and engines that can be used throughout the journey to help you reach the finish line.

steps.headline: Use the Bellows or Fan tools on timed levels that require you to reach the finish line within a certain period of time.
steps.description: The Bellows and Fan tools provide your vehicle with extra momentum so you can move faster toward the finish line.

steps.headline: Use TNT to remove objects and barriers that prevent your vehicle from moving forward toward the finish line.
steps.description: When detonated at the right time, TNT will blow up obstacles that stand in your way.

steps.headline: Use Soda Bottles or Balloons when facing inclines throughout your journey.
steps.description: When pointing downward toward the ground, Soda Bottles allow your vehicle to fly high so you can conquer hills and collect stars.

steps.headline: Survey each level before building your vehicle so you can plan accordingly.
steps.description: This allows you to see whether any hills, gaps, or other obstacles should be taken into consideration so you can build a vehicle that takes your piggy to the finish line.

steps.headline: Try placing wheels on the top and sides of your vehicle if twists, turns, and hills have you stumped on certain levels.
steps.description: Not all vehicles must be built in a traditional manner to help you advance toward the finish line.

steps.headline: Try activating different-colored soda bottles at different times throughout your journey.
steps.description: This can help prevent your vehicle from surging forward and crashing when all soda bottles are activated at the same time.

steps.headline: Use metal tools instead of wood tools to build sturdier vehicles on “Krak Snap” levels.
steps.description: The goal of these levels is to cross the finish line with your entire vehicle intact.

steps.headline: Build longer vehicles when balance is key to completing the level.
steps.description: Longer vehicles are less likely to tip over than shorter vehicles, and will help you maintain balance.

steps.headline: Try shifting and moving various objects around on the vehicle to change weight distribution.
steps.description: Your vehicle may end up driving more efficiently when weight is distributed properly.

text: Learning the Basics Launch Bad Piggies and tap on the “Play” button.  Tap on “Ground Hog Day,” then select level one. When you first start playing Bad Piggies, you’ll only have access to the first set of levels, categorized as “Ground Hog Day.” Familiarize yourself with the game’s layout. After the game launches, you’ll be shown a screen with six empty boxes placed in a grid pattern, along with various supplies at the bottom of the screen. Your goal is to drag and drop each of the supplies into the grid to create a vehicle that can be used to transport your piggy to the finish line. For example, level one provides you with two wheels and three boxes. Click and drag each supply over to its position in the grid to create a vehicle. For example, in level one you must move both wheels to the bottom of the grid, then place all three boxes on top of the wheels to create a boxcar, or wagon. Click and drag the piggy over to your vehicle. This places the piggy in the vehicle so it can be driven to the finish line. Click on the checkmark icon. Your vehicle will start driving by itself toward the finish line. Once you’ve crossed the finish line, you can advance to the next level. Practicing Tips and Strategies Use the buttons displayed at the bottom of the screen to help you reach your goal after your vehicle starts driving on its own. These buttons feature extra tools such as balloons, bottle rockets, motors, and engines that can be used throughout the journey to help you reach the finish line. Use the Bellows or Fan tools on timed levels that require you to reach the finish line within a certain period of time. The Bellows and Fan tools provide your vehicle with extra momentum so you can move faster toward the finish line. Use TNT to remove objects and barriers that prevent your vehicle from moving forward toward the finish line. When detonated at the right time, TNT will blow up obstacles that stand in your way. Use Soda Bottles or Balloons when facing inclines throughout your journey. When pointing downward toward the ground, Soda Bottles allow your vehicle to fly high so you can conquer hills and collect stars. Survey each level before building your vehicle so you can plan accordingly. This allows you to see whether any hills, gaps, or other obstacles should be taken into consideration so you can build a vehicle that takes your piggy to the finish line. Try placing wheels on the top and sides of your vehicle if twists, turns, and hills have you stumped on certain levels. Not all vehicles must be built in a traditional manner to help you advance toward the finish line. Try activating different-colored soda bottles at different times throughout your journey. This can help prevent your vehicle from surging forward and crashing when all soda bottles are activated at the same time. Use metal tools instead of wood tools to build sturdier vehicles on “Krak Snap” levels. The goal of these levels is to cross the finish line with your entire vehicle intact. Build longer vehicles when balance is key to completing the level. Longer vehicles are less likely to tip over than shorter vehicles, and will help you maintain balance. Try shifting and moving various objects around on the vehicle to change weight distribution. Your vehicle may end up driving more efficiently when weight is distributed properly.
